B2 [ C ] an area on the edge of a large town or city where people who work in the town or city often live: Box Hill is a suburb of Melbourne. We drove from middle-class suburbs to a very poor inner-city area. the suburbs [ plural ]
the outer area of a town, rather than the shopping and business centre in the middle: The company decided to relocate to the suburbs because the rent was much cheaper.
